snippet: Opponents said the law’s intent was simply to limit electoral participation by poor, student and elderly voters.
abstract: Pennsylvania's voter identification law, one of nation's strictest, returns to state court in case that opponents hope will end once and for all requirements they say are meant to limit electoral participation by poor, student and elderly voters.
lead_paragraph: Opponents said the law’s intent was simply to limit electoral participation by poor, student and elderly voters.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Defends Law on ID for Voters
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Defends Law on ID For Voters
